meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before a convention
meanings.sent1: The preconvention meeting was held to discuss the event details.
meanings.sent2: It is common to have preconvention activities before the main event.
meanings.sent3: The preconvention decorations were put up in the wrong room by mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her preconvention decision to arrive early saved her from the traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The preconvention atmosphere was filled with excitement and anticipation.

meanings.definition: A belief or opinion formed beforehand without adequate evidence
meanings.sent1: His preconvention about the outcome of the meeting was proven wrong.
meanings.sent2: She held a strong preconvention that the new policy would fail.
meanings.sent3: The preconvention about the weather turned out to be completely inaccurate.
meanings.sent4: Their preconvention acted as a barrier to considering other perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The preconvention led to misunderstandings and conflicts among the team members.
